visualization_prompt: Generate a stockChart showing AAPL stock price trends using Highcharts' time-series capabilities with external data fetching
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains time-series financial data with two key dimensions: date (temporal) and closing price (continuous quantitative). While actual stock data would show typical market characteristics like volatility clustering and non-normal returns distribution, the synthetic example demonstrates realistic price ranges ($100-$200) and temporal patterns. The stockChart type maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant chart elements while preserving temporal context through Highcharts' built-in navigator panel. Cairo's principles are applied through pre-attentive color coding (blue series) and proportional axis labeling. The range selector implements interactive data density control, allowing users to validate short-term fluctuations against long-term trends. Time formatting follows financial convention (MMM YYYY) while price values maintain dollar precision through formatted tooltips.
